subject: Limitation on Home Installation of Junit
msgSnippet: The instructions tell me: don t install the junit.jar into the extension directory of your JDK installation. If you do so the test class on the files system
messageBody:
The instructions tell me: "don't install the junit.jar into the extension directory of your JDK installation. If you do so the test class on the files system will not be found."
 
I suppose I don't understand why the design is this way.
 
I'd like to use Junit at home on my WIN95 machine, but I have to rely on the /ext folder because I can't set a CLASSPATH in that environment.
 
Can anyone suggest a work-around to this limitation?
 
- Al
 
<><><><><><><>
Albert Valente,
alv@...
<><><><><><><>
